intro: Teucrium lanuginosum, commonly known as velvet germander, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, clustered blue or purple flowers in the summer months, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Its aromatic leaves and medicinal properties have made it historically valued in traditional herbal medicine.
